website_summaries.verdict: A simple, bargain-priced pull-up bar that you can easily store.
pros: Sleek and simple design comes in a chrome-plated steel bar
Easily adjusts to fit your doorway (up to 91.5 centimeters)
Comfort grips avoid discomfort and slippage
The simple design makes it easy to store away when not in use
cons: The hand grips are not adjustable, so it is not as comfortable to do close-grip or wide-grip pull-ups

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS.  Dangerous!  Caused a serious fall and subsequent  shoulder transplant.
customer_reviews.text: Should not even give this one star .Installed bar in included brackets. Used for about six months. While I was doing a forward stretch it popped from the brackets, throwing me across the room and my right arm into a wall. My shoulder was dislocated and the head of the humerus destroyed. I had to have a reverse partial shoulder replacement which has taken (so far) three months of my life and cost (so far) well over $30000. The bar shortened in length during use despite set screw set "tight." This is a class action accident waiting to happen The product should be removed from the market.
customer_reviews.author: tay

customer_reviews.title: No WAY this is new !!!
customer_reviews.text: Check my photos to see what I got, this is not a new product, this is used. Yes I know, this is the cheapest bar you can find in Amazon, but at least know what you are getting before you buy. I will update my review after I test it for a week, spoiler alert; it does not look sturdy. I am sure I will return it.
customer_reviews.author: Drake Diab

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Install, non-intimidating to use
customer_reviews.text: This was easy, even for a short "old lady" to install. I didn't use the screws, just twisted it into place as instructed. After a few weeks it still hasn't budged. It gets used every day for hanging briefly -- I can hear my spine clicking back into place -- and very mini pull-ups. Someday they might be feet-of-the-floor pull-ups, but right now my feet don't leave the floor. It relieves end of day strain from computer work and my long commute. Great tool for reversing muscle loss and helping keep shoulders strong and functional, not to mention the benefit to arm strength.
customer_reviews.author: Hermosa

customer_reviews.title: If you read one review read this one.
customer_reviews.text: Sometimes I’m glad I ignore the negative reviews of products I buy because so many times I have loved things that others hated. In this case I wish I had heeded the warnings. All of the complaints are legitimate from the cheap screws strip when you put them in to the rotating bar that never lets you get a good grip to the terrible design that lengthens the bar when using it so much that it pushed my doorframe out and cracked it. The product description is all marketing hyperbole. Company should be ashamed and Amazon should stop pedaling this garbage.
customer_reviews.author: FlamingoBeGone

customer_reviews.title: Misleading description and missing parts
customer_reviews.text: Description says up to 36". But the instructions say 35" max. Who has a 35" door??? I have standard 36" doors. I had to extend it a bit past the stamped max line. And I supplemented it with a ratchet strap in the middle. Mine is also missing all the screws and one of the non-weight bearing mounts for using it for sit-ups and such. The grip pads are fixed in place and are too narrow for me, so I have to grip the bare bar and the plastic things on the end of the center bar section.
customer_reviews.author: John W

customer_reviews.title: Butts and Feelings were hurt
customer_reviews.text: This bar is sturdy and well made but one major downside is that it has no locking mechanism and just a little bit of movement on it causes it to spin (and you drop). My daughter was doing pull ups and each time she'd grab the bar and pull it would unwind just a bit and finally she jumped up and it came loose and fell on her. Now I realize I got what I paid for, and I should have paid more for one that had locking mechanisms. But being a newbie, I didn't realize it would un-spin itself so easily.
customer_reviews.author: S. Richard

customer_reviews.title: DON'T BUY THIS PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: Seriously don't buy this product. The bar is horribly made. It wiggles and pieces don't stay in their correct place. They also supply you with horrible screws that strip in one second, I even predrilled the hole and they still striped. If you buy this product expect to not get it out of the doorway. Let's say I put it up wrong, there is still no directions so it's not like you know.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremiah

customer_reviews.title: Put a mat underneath
customer_reviews.text: I use the bar to do pull-ups from a prone position (kind of like girl-style push-ups). Based on other reviews, I put two pillows (train style, not one on top of the other) underneath - the bar is about 3 feet high. I make sure the bar is tight before I start, but even then the bar has fallen once, but with the padding underneath, I didn't get hurt. It's worth the money, though - I don't want to spend more to get the spring loaded kind, as I'm just a casual user. Just make sure to use precautions, though.
customer_reviews.author: Music lover

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY.
customer_reviews.text: We bought this as a simple chin up bar for our two school aged children. After screwing the brackets into the door way and completely tightening, the center bar with the pads still spins. I don't know if ours is defective but the center bar just spins everytime you put weight on it. The first time my 70lb child was doing pullups she cut her chin on the screws that are awkwardly placed right in the center of the bar where you complete a pull up. Poor design. After a few attempts the entire bar came spinning out of the doorframe on her head. We will be returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Extremely sturdy.  Small hiccups during installation.
customer_reviews.text: The bar was not difficult to install and it's very sturdy. The bar adjusts by twisting each side counterclockwise. I had one issue when I first tried to adjust the width of the bar. One side would spin but it wouldn't move. I fixed this by removing the two screws in the middle of the bar and twisting the side that wouldn't adjust before. After it started to move, I replaced the screws. Now it works normally.
customer_reviews.author: salamakajakawak

customer_reviews.title: Great pull-up bar! Pros greatly outweigh the cons.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Great price. Bar was easy to install. It is very sturdy. Cons: I find the grips too close together for my comfort (I end up placing my hands on the outer edge of the grips so they just get in the way instead of helping me grip). I can only use the bar for strict pull-ups, strict toes-to-bar, etc... It's not recommended for kipping or jumping pull-ups. Overall: For the price and convenience, the pros greatly outweigh the cons. I ended up using other grips (Soft GRIP POWER PADS - ALTERNATIVE TO GYM GLOVES, Weight Lifting Straps and Gloves  ) on top of the bar since the ones on the bar aren't useful for me.
customer_reviews.author: Lisette Garcia

customer_reviews.title: its otherwise a good product.
customer_reviews.text: Worked well, my daughter loves it, however be careful where you mount it. Our doorframe starts to separate at the top when tightened too much. We just tighten it enough that it stays in place and use it as is. If you overtighten, you might damage your door frame so be aware. I think that's true of all similar bars, however. So just look out for it. I wish there was also a way to stop it from turning as it is possible to accidentally loosen it while you use it if not careful. As long as the user understands this, its otherwise a good product.
customer_reviews.author: Mark GildenTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Good Product! I Recommend!
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to install, only needs a screwdriver. Seems to be very strong. All screws, brackets etc included. Very comfortable to work out on it. Can be extended on both sides to fit various door frame sizes. Has a nice finish. Stays strong in place and doesn't move. Update: been using it for a few months now. Still no change. Good quality. Looks like it'll last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Ari Hershkowitz

customer_reviews.title: Better than other designs
customer_reviews.text: Easy installation; sturdy. At the price it's hard to think of anything wrong with it. I would've preferred knurled grips rather than pads, but that's just me. People fail to appreciate how since the cantilevered pull up bars, that are currently more popular need to be taken down when the door is closed, can only work on molding of a certain size, and has to face the opposite direction of the door seeing, you're quite limited as to where you can put it. Also, it's a lot easier to spackle drill holes in the frame (from this type of pull up bar) than replace dented molding which results from the other style.
customer_reviews.author: F

customer_reviews.title: Cheap but Functional
customer_reviews.text: The screws are low quality and strip during installation. One stripped completely about halfway through. I had to remove it by turning it with pliers, which is a giant pain. I then had to find another screw to finish the install. The foam tips do not move and are too close together. I ended up cutting them off and now I can put them wherever I need. After all of this, it works fine and seems stable so far
customer_reviews.author: IP from Cali

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I put this up in the hall entrance. Once I figured out the screws, everything went perfect. I have had a 350+ pound friend hang on the bar with no problem. It did not even flex. I use it to help me with my upper body stretching (shoulders) and doing chin ups. My wife moves it to the lower position and does sit ups. I like that I could mount it where I wanted, and not forced to compromise on position.
customer_reviews.author: Thorman

customer_reviews.title: It Came Early
customer_reviews.text: Well I got this way before I received the pulley system. But I have it all put together now . It looks like it's going to work out great. If anything changes I will update. It did come with instructions. But you don't need them. It's so simple.
customer_reviews.author: Teri

customer_reviews.title: Poorly made, but functional.
customer_reviews.text: The chrome is heavily pitted in spots, and looks cheap. Probably made somewhere in Asia, with few quality controls. Another example of poor manufacturing: There are two pan-head Phillips screws in the middle of the bar, 180-degrees apart. With whoever built this, the screwdriver or drill slipped in the head, creating burs on each screw. They could have taken a bit more care assembling this, or at least filed the heads down, so the user doesn't get cut! That's what I did. Better yet, use a screw that has a lower-profile, and cover both screws with that black, foam-rubber stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff K.

customer_reviews.title: Great bar, easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Great bar, easy to install. Very sturdy. The foam pads on the bar are comfortable. The only downside is that the way I tend to grip the bar causes maybe a quarter turn every time I use it, which gradually loosens the bar. Maybe I need to flip it end to end or face the other way so my grip tends to tighten rather than loosen. Either way, not really a knock on the bar itself, just something to pay attention to. Great to have a bar in a convenient place so I have no excuse not to bang out a set of pullups every time I pass (well... not every time, but that's not the bar's fault).
customer_reviews.author: mdc

customer_reviews.title: Delivered to wrong address
customer_reviews.text: Delivered to wrong address. When I located the package, most of the packing tape was coming off the top (I know that the residents of the other house didn't do it because no one was home and all their mail was still in their mailbox). There were no installation intructions included - just metal end pieces and a bunch of extra screws and plastic pieces.
customer_reviews.author: bptr

customer_reviews.title: Padded part slipping after 1 week of use
customer_reviews.text: Works great, esp for cost. Super easy to set up ( I didnt use the kit, just suspension as I am 110-120lbs and primary user.) 160lb significant other does not trust its sturdiness but can use. Heavier friends have tried it out as well and its still sturdy. Only complaint is that the padded handle part on one side is slipping (rotating around the bar).
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Great for a gymnast
customer_reviews.text: I bought this chin up bar for my daughter to build strength for gymnastics. She absolutely loves it! The pads are very comfortable and can be moved along the bar. The bar stays in place and can be removed when not in use. While in use, it never gets out of place. I am extremely impressed by this bar. I even went on it to make sure it would hold up and it did. I highly recommend this bar.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany

customer_reviews.title: Bad screws!
customer_reviews.text: The bar is fine. But you can strip these screws with a finger nail! No joke. What are they, aluminum??? How hard is it to include some normal screws? Dollar store screws are even better. And they weren't even all the same kind! It was a medley of shit screws. WTF? come on.
customer_reviews.author: Dan McDonald

customer_reviews.title: Simple, effective, sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This bar is really simple, but for $20 I couldn't ask for an easier, more effective pull up bar. Installation took only a minute. You simply twist out each end until the bar holds in the door frame. Then you twist the center of the bar until it holds tight. It comes with mounting screws and stuff, but I didn't even use them. The pressure alone holds my weight (I'm light, at about 130lbs). I imagine anyone under 160lbs could get away without using the proper mounting equipment. Anyone heavier will want to make sure it's installed properly. And that's all there is to this bar. It's cheap, sturdy, and a cinch to set up.
customer_reviews.author: Seth Balmore

customer_reviews.title: Faulty/cheap hardware
customer_reviews.text: The hardware provided with this item is just not of good quality. I followed the instruction for installation. I had to use some of m own hardware in order to make the item safe to use. I had one screw that stripped out really easily and another that the head completely broke off once the screw was in the wall leaving the other end still in the wall which forced me to have to move the holder and to use some better quality screws. I’ve never had a head of a screw completely break off before. Before buying please make sure you have good quality screw at home to make this item safe to use.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected
customer_reviews.text: So far I’m pleased with this product. I have had it installed for a few weeks now. Installation was simple and have had no issues since. My only complaint is some sort of locking feature would be appreciated. As it is, you have to be conscious of rotation everytime you use it. A feature to lock the expansion rotation feature would solve this problem. Besides that minor complaint, it works exactly as advertised and is suitable for exactly my needs.
customer_reviews.author: AkGuy

customer_reviews.title: Very dangerous, returning it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product for my children but it is dangerous. The screws were missing so we just tighten it enough that it would stay in place. When my husband tried it first, it popped out and came off. I returned it. I paid $15.93 for the product but the refund was $14.39. I wonder why the refund was less. I don't recommend the product.
customer_reviews.author: OV

customer_reviews.title: Does not extend to 36” and spins
customer_reviews.text: Does not extend to 36” and spins - extend about 33”, and there’s no way to secure it at that size - no locking. I have not had a chance to use it as it simply does not fit my doorframe. Try to extend it to max before installing the brackets - I now have brackets and no bar. Wish I had checked the manufacturer’s claim before installing the brackets. 🤦‍♀️. I also procrastinated and now it’s too late to return this stupid thing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and strong. Tougher than my doorframe.
customer_reviews.text: Works great and very stable. One side is reverse threaded so you can just turn the center in one direction to tighten or loosen. Be careful with your doorframe; this guy is so sturdy, it caused some flex on the doorframe I installed it on. Comes with two types of mounting hardware for versatility.
customer_reviews.author: Brendan

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy Stable But Not Easy to Install
customer_reviews.text: For me this is probably a super good device. It's very stable and sturdy. It's up there good. But no it's not easy to install in an old brownstone in NYC when the walls are made out of concrete and plaster. BUT you can eventually get this puppy in and once you do it's a strong mount. It works great. With no worry about it staying place. And it's a really good value for your money! Probs the best out there.
customer_reviews.author: Kid Amnesiac

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: The bar seems to dislodge a little after every use (you need to rotate it back into place after doing your set). The screw heads are easily stripped, so be sure to use a power drill with a drill bit before drilling in the screws. If you're concerned about an accident (bar dislodging, breaking off, etc), just place a cushion underneath yourself before using.
customer_reviews.author: TA

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic bar
customer_reviews.text: I really love this bar! no cons whatsoever! For such a cheap price I am able to get a great pullup bar that stays out of the way and is barely noticeable. I use it every morning and night, and I weigh 160lbs, it holds me just fine. It is easy to take down and put up if need be, just be prepared to put some screws into the door frame! (screws included)
customer_reviews.author: Nate Fuller

customer_reviews.title: Impossible
customer_reviews.text: My son is VERY handy, and even with my help, we were unable to get this up in the doorway properly, in order for him to use it. The seller handled it with no problem, but we were disappointed. Too bad, because the price was also better than most, and seems to have worked for others.
customer_reviews.author: okie dokie

customer_reviews.title: Worth it's price overall
customer_reviews.text: It's pretty easy to install. Drill some pilot holes using the provided brackets as the guide and just drill in the brackets evenly. The screws are pretty cheaply made and will strip VERY easily so he careful not to start stripping them. Brackets are thinner metal but seem to work. The bar is pretty solid. Takes FOREVER to screw in and out for me though. I weigh 160 and it holds me pretty well. It IS a cheap bar, and that's fine. You save money at the expensive of slightly higher risk. I use mine every few hours and I'm even missing a screw xD
customer_reviews.author: Luke J. Lovell

customer_reviews.title: Cheap screws
customer_reviews.text: Actually, I'm kind of stuck - the screw heads immediately stripped as I was installing the brackets. I now need to get someone else to remove the half installed bracket so that I can put in better screws. (Sorry, I love to buy tools but am terrible with them - no the drill didn't slip - the metal of the screws is more like playdoh than metal.) All that means is that I haven't been able to use the bar because I can't get the brackets mounted. I'd suggest buying better screws before trying to install the bar.
customer_reviews.author: Marge M

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: Screws for mounting as a weight bearing chin up bar seem a but short. I used my own longer ones to be sure of solid connection. Only down side was that one of the two black plastic protective rings was broken upon receipt. Seller does not stock this replacement item and only option was to return to whole thing to Amazon and get a complete product replacement. Not worth that, so will live with this little issue.
customer_reviews.author: Fuzzy

customer_reviews.title: Perfect and Heavy Duty - No Brainer Buy
customer_reviews.text: This is GREAT. I was skeptical because some reviews stated this would come lose, but ordered thinking I could fix that -- NOT NECESSARY! This is extremely well made, and the ONLY reasons it could come lose is a lack of understanding that the turn direction must be over-the-top toward the user (to keep it in the tightening direction) or that the door frame is very weak (not the bar). Excellent buy!
customer_reviews.author: P. Tuggle

customer_reviews.title: Best for non-standard doors -- don't overtighten
customer_reviews.text: If you have an older home with non-standard doors, this works wonders. It's solid, reliable and easy to set up. You can do pull-ups on it. A couple notes: 1) Don't overtighten. Assuming you're within the weight limit, tightening the screws won't actually 'support' you more, it will just increase the tension and the chance of your wood breaking / splitting 2) Be careful during installation. Since this isn't hanging, you'll want to make sure that the brackets are set up at the right height and distance. Use a measuring tape. After that, you're good to go--great device for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and great price!
customer_reviews.text: We got this back in March to attach my 9 yr old son's Sensory Swing too. It was a very quick install and it's super sturdy. My oldest son is 230ish and it has held him and his friends when doing pull ups. My 11 and 13 yr old's swing and do pull ups with no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Melba Toast

customer_reviews.title: as the bar itself is pretty loose in fit - although if it weren't
customer_reviews.text: Difficult to install and adjust. It rattles around a lot when using it, even when taut with the frame, as the bar itself is pretty loose in fit - although if it weren't, it might be impossible to adjust the length at all. Barely long enough for my door frame. It's held up in the time I've had it, but I'm kinda waiting for it to fall apart at this point.
customer_reviews.author: Crow

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for your buck
customer_reviews.text: This is generally the pull up bar I recommend to all my friends who want a home bar. This tension Rod style mounting is a lot more friendly to door frames than the bigger pull up bars that hook on door frames, I generally have had trouble with other pull up bars fitting my door frames but this one works great. Would recommend a drill if you don’t have one yet. I weigh 225 and do about 30 pull-ups a day on it, no bending on the bar or damage from where it’s mounted on the door.
customer_reviews.author: Paulie Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Very nice for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Sturdier than I expected. So far it works well for me, and I’m near the maximum weight of 220#. I subtracted one star because it needs better instructions for installation: 1) Eight screws are included. The two that are different are for attaching the little black brackets near the floor. The other six are for mounting the silver brackets 2 inches from top of doorway. 2) Drill pilot holes!!! 3) When extending bar, screw it out equally from each side for best support.
customer_reviews.author: fclkeary

customer_reviews.title: Crappy design - avoid this one.
customer_reviews.text: Lousy design. How do you screw up something this simple??? Bar has nothing to keep it from spinning as you grab/hang from it. Since it is expanded or contracted by screwing the ends in/out, it has a tendency to loosen itself from the support brackets over time as it spins. I had an old bar whose design was SO much better since it had heavy duty kotter pins in the end to prevent spinning and the width was adjusted by sliding tubes with a spring loaded pin. Would not buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Richard G

customer_reviews.title: Awesome value, but take your time installing
customer_reviews.text: This is great...but install it correctly!!!!! Tension is definitely ONLY for sit-ups. For pull-ups, properly mount this directly into studs or using all included anchors. Included screws were a bit weak so I used my own. I recommend doing the same if you weigh over 175. Works as expected when installed with care so if you're not comfortable sinking an anchor or finding a stud, find someone who is or buy something else.
customer_reviews.author: A Meza

customer_reviews.title: Great Value.
customer_reviews.text: It works great. I keep an eye on adjustment, it may loosen a little so I tighten it, by turning towards me. My installation was only using with rubber tip ends. Since in a garage side door, with cement block, the metal cups were not used for install.
customer_reviews.author: Llama David

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous value!
customer_reviews.text: Frankly, I was shocked at the quality of this pull up bar. It's sturdy, easy to install, and will last a lifetime. More it has grip material to help with comfort and to prevent slippage. Really impressed, and wow, is it ever worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: damages door frame
customer_reviews.text: Do not go with a tension rod, buy the kind that hooks over the door frame. This product must be tensioned very tightly to stay up (it relies purely on friction force), and can crack the door frame. I weight only 115 lbs and had trouble with the rod slipping.
customer_reviews.author: EDL

customer_reviews.title: Five stars! Buy it.
customer_reviews.text: Works great. After about eight months of having this on my boys bedroom door and encouraging them My 12 year old boys can do full pull ups now. I use it alot myself. Very solid once you install it properly.
customer_reviews.author: Dude

customer_reviews.title: Great way for my kids to get some wiggles out!
customer_reviews.text: This is great! We did the extra attachments to stabilize the bar. It's awesome. I have 3 kids and they love to swing on it. They do the occasional pull up, but it's been a fun inside activity. It's great for adults too. But let's face it, pull ups are HARD!
customer_reviews.author: KKMama

customer_reviews.title: NOT for 36" wide doorway
customer_reviews.text: I installed the Sunny Bar in a 36" doorway. My 140 lbs caused it to sag slightly in the middle as I hung from it. After two weeks of using daily, it fell (and me with it) as I was lifting myself. I put it back up, but it is noticeably bent now and creaks when I hang from it. (The photo doesn't show very well.) I've stopped using it and have ordered a more robust - I hope - bar.
customer_reviews.author: Maddy

customer_reviews.title: Bar rotated while in use, no locking mechanism
customer_reviews.text: As a pull-up bar it works so far. Other than that I wouldn’t recommend it. To tighten or loosen the bar you have to spin the bar to get both ends to loosen or widen to you door. Good idea but bad overall, since when you do pull-ups the dang bar will either loosen or tighten as it doesn’t have a locking mechanism. So beware to always check the bar is in the brackets and also make sure the bar is not tightened all the way as it will pop your door frame.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't creak or shift...
customer_reviews.text: Unlike my last pull-up bar that rested on the top of the door frame, this one screwed and could be easily removed and most of all it was SILENT, which was very nice with sleeping family. I didn't feel a single budge and like being able to take it down easily. Very good value for my money! Still no wear on the grips and it's been over five months!
customer_reviews.author: Wyatt Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Who would have thought a straight bar has so many uses
customer_reviews.text: Works and fits with no issues. Happy with the purchase. I don't recommend the small rubber knobs you can use to position it. I prefer the metal cup thingys. It comes with both so you can choose. My daughter does her gymnastics on it. I think she uses it more than me. I like to stretch my back out with it. My son makes pitiful attempts to do pull ups on it. The bar gets a lot more use out of it than I thought it would.
customer_reviews.author: Miriam F.

customer_reviews.title: BE WARNED!
customer_reviews.text: This pull-up bar may seem affordable, but it will damage your wall frame in the long run as the set-up process requires drilling into your door frame. I’m a college student and I can’t do that or I will get in trouble with the university, and if I install this at home, I will get in trouble with my parents. You’re better off investing $20-30 more to get a pull-up bar that doesn’t require drilling into your door frame, and is actually good quality (other users have reported the bar not being secure when using it, even after drilling it into the door frame).
customer_reviews.author: Snowz

customer_reviews.title: bought it for the kids, but noticed that when ...
customer_reviews.text: bought it for the kids, but noticed that when they swing even a little (which happens when they jump up and grab the bar), the bar comes off. This was kind of risky because my son almost fell down because of it.
customer_reviews.author: MP

customer_reviews.title: It holds
customer_reviews.text: The bar comes with pieces that fit the ends in order to screw into your doorway, I found this unnecessary and simply pushed the bumpers into the door, this way I can move it as I please. I have had a 200 person test this and it held, also there is a screw that sticks out in the very middle so watch out for that.
customer_reviews.author: megan ulsch

customer_reviews.title: Not great for older child gymnastics workouts
customer_reviews.text: For some reason I thought no screws, holes or drilling into walls would be involved and I was wrong. After a few days it put indentations deep into the walls. We used it for pull ups, swinging and pull over practice
customer_reviews.author: E. sapp

customer_reviews.title: Good product if installed properly
customer_reviews.text: My 11 year old daughter is in gymnastics and this was a great gift. It fits fine in our standard doorway and seems durable. We haven't installed it properly yet - bolting it to the frame with the provided hardware. This is absolutely necessary or the bar will twist loose out of the door frame. She is about 75 pounds and has pulled it out of the door frame once with it just twisted in there. My husband and I wouldn't dare hang on it until it's screwed in!
customer_reviews.author: AgM

customer_reviews.title: I bought two of these -- one for each of ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these -- one for each of my sons -- on the assumption that the brackets/screws were not needed. When I tried to install the first one, I ended up with a split in the wood door frame at one of the top corners. Several other attempts were equally fruitless. I have thrown away the first bar and am returning the second bar.
customer_reviews.author: LC

customer_reviews.title: This is a great pull up bar and was extremely easy to install
customer_reviews.text: This is a great pull up bar and was extremely easy to install. I did not have to predrill holes. I am 5'7/120 so not really anywhere near the max of 225 lbs. I was nervous to try it and envisioned it ripping out of the wall but it didn't! It hasn't even budged. It looks great, is not an eye sore and a total DEAL for $14.
customer_reviews.author: whatzthepointTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Not bad!!!
customer_reviews.text: I am teaching my kids how to pull up, and this is the best tool for them. I installed it in their height level where they can barely reach. In case they fall or slip they won't get hurt. I am sure it was made for adults which is why it is little thicker for my kids to hold it. Other than that it is perfect!!! Once they done it is easy to take it away from the door. Recommended....
customer_reviews.author: Ulan

customer_reviews.title: Pretty nice BUT
customer_reviews.text: The bar itself is built pretty nicely for the low price. Not too much to say about that. However, the screws that come with the assembly are the cheapest screws I've ever seen and every single one of the screw heads stripped when trying to install. I'd advise everyone to use other screws not the ones they give you. Once you get past that, you've got yourself a pretty sweet bar for 20 ish bucks.
customer_reviews.author: Brendan P.

customer_reviews.title: Not bad.
customer_reviews.text: I always look at the reviews before buying anything and this one got #1 for pull up bars on Amazon plus the price was reasonable but some reviews states some got injures. I didnt mount to my wall yet but it has good tension without it but I'm scared to just leave it like that. So eventually I'll mount it to the wall. It does leave a black stain on the wall and the paint can clip off the wall but I have good walls. Overall it's good, no complaints so far but I will be extra careful.
customer_reviews.author: Tyesha

customer_reviews.title: Damage to the door frame
customer_reviews.text: The Sunny Health & Fitness doorway was easy to install and came with all hardware needed, the problem I am having is its starting to take down my door frame as shown in the picture. My teenage boys are using it and the are both just a little over 100 pounds so that's not a lot of weight? It's says it holds up to 500 pounds? I would not buy this again due to all the damage it has caused on door frame.
customer_reviews.author: brandy oneal

customer_reviews.title: Reasonably sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Came with two sets on brackets. We put the beefy ones up high for the adults, and the other ones for lower exercises at kid height so our climber would have something other than the walls to hang from. Reasonably sturdy. My 200lb husband can use it though it does look like it wants to bend in the middle, it holds out just fine.
customer_reviews.author: SpectralEdge

customer_reviews.title: Turns while using it. Don't recommend.
customer_reviews.text: Didn't work for us. Got it mounted but since it tightens by turning whenever we'd use it it would continue to turn, either getting loose or tightening more and pushing my door frame out of alignment. Looked to see if there was a locking mechanism to prevent this and there was not anything like that. Replaced with different model the same week. This is now in our laundry room collecting dust.
customer_reviews.author: luzdelamar

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT USE SCREWS IT COMES WITH. Too soft of metal and it stripps just from trying to install.
customer_reviews.text: It aint the most solid piece of metal bar. It is mos def more solid than a door frame clip on one. The rubber ends does stick to the door frame from alll the pressure. I pulled out some paint.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffers

customer_reviews.title: I would like to be able to do both close grip pull ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this door way pull up bar as all of my door ways have too high of headers to fit typical pull up bars that I am used to. I was skeptical about the rigidity of the product, but I was pleasantly surprised as I have had it up for months now and it has not budged. I use it fairly often. The only thing I could complain about is that it does not have adjustable hand grips. I would like to be able to do both close grip pull ups along with wide grip pull ups without having to slide them over (which takes a good amount of time). Overall, this product is great for its price.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Marotte

customer_reviews.title: pretty good for me, but I would be leary if I was heavier...
customer_reviews.text: I am 170 pounds and can hang from it, but I wish the metal was the next level thicker. Great value, and it seems otherwise pretty sturdy, The handgrips are definitely too close, not sure if they are glued...
customer_reviews.author: JiGo

customer_reviews.title: screws too weak to use
customer_reviews.text: This arrived with screws made of what must be the cheapest metal available - The first three stripped before they could even fully insert, at which point I gave up before ruining my door frame any further.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Smith

customer_reviews.title: Ok ?
customer_reviews.text: It works fine but the end caps on the bar don’t stay on the bar like they’re supposed to and get stuck on to both the large and small stabilizers. Questionable safety work this issue. I wouldn’t use it to max weight capacity.
customer_reviews.author: RGH

customer_reviews.title: Super duper
customer_reviews.text: We have two installed in two separate doorways. They've each held up to 180 lbs without a problem, but we also did not trust the tiny screws that came with the package and installed with screws that are a little more heavy-duty. Haven't had an issue with the door frame giving away like some other reviewers have experienced. We've used them regularly for about a year now and they're doing just fine. Lots of bang for each buck. Definite recommend here.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: For a great price, this is exactly what I need on my fitness journey. Easy to install, the bar is quick to put in and remove as needed. Found this on an Amazon list for best item for the cost and I certainly agree.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Unsafe at maximum width
customer_reviews.text: I used this in a door way that is the maximum width allowed. The bar loosened in the brackets even when no one had used it. Fortunately I checked the bar before each use. The plastic on the ends of the bar was ground up by the screws inside the brackets. I stopped using this bar and installed a safer one.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Super easy setup!
customer_reviews.text: I set this up in my closet door frame (so that it's out of sight). I'm so excited about finally being able to do pull/chin ups that I do some every time I walk past it. It doesn't damage the door frame, and it's strong enough to support my boyfriend's weight too. Note: It stays in place by turning in like a shower rod, so you can only do pull ups from one side. If you do it from the other side it will unscrew it. Totally fine if you are aware of this and stay on the correct side though.
customer_reviews.author: Danny

customer_reviews.title: Stays in place firmly and never slips
customer_reviews.text: Fit the door perfectly and was very strong. It would stay firmly in place after being tightened. The holders were solid as well. I definitely recommend this for any home gym. I contacted the company to order another set of door clamps and they promptly delivered them to me. Good product and good company.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Harmon

customer_reviews.title: Bar shortens or lengthens to fit door frame / but destroys it in the process
customer_reviews.text: Because the bar rotates when you grip it and pull, it actually either shortens or lengthens. So, rather than loosening the bar I made sure to face, grip, and pull in the direction that would keep the bar tight. The drawback being that it has now destroyed my door frame. :(
customer_reviews.author: Jenny Del Rosario

customer_reviews.title: Solid
customer_reviews.text: this is a solid piece of equipment. very stable. very strong. very well made. it works like a turnbuckle, in reverse, I suppose. (Like a spreader.) For you that don't know how that works, get someone to explain it or show you. I didn't buy this for chin ups, but got it to use as a balance bar when rebounding. (makes all the difference.) so I didn't/don't have to drill holes, etc. shipping was fast also. I probably won't ever use it for chin ups, but if I do, I will feel confident using it. get a rebounder, you won't regret that either.
customer_reviews.author: anon7

customer_reviews.title: Get it, mount it, good to go.
customer_reviews.text: Does exactly what it should at a great price. I can't believe how many people are writing that they are installing this without the mounting cups. That is REALLY unsafe. The mounting cups are easy to put up and generally inconspicuous. The fact that it stays up without them for a lot of people is a nod to the quality of this bar I guess...but you people are nuts. One complaint is that I wish there was more padding. Yes you can adjust it, but you are still limited because you can't really do wide grip pull ups. Oh well, I guess I can just get some workout gloves
customer_reviews.author: Wes V

customer_reviews.title: Great if installed with screws
customer_reviews.text: This bar is pretty solid and will work perfectly if well installed. I very strongly suggest to install the bar with the screws, as supporting it only with the "expandable spring" effect will not hold any weight. I tried installing the bar only with the expandable effect and just performing a dead hang, the bar clearly slips (I weigh around 150-160 lbs.) The padding (grips) on the bar are very thin and not very comfortable if you are doing the pull/chin ups barehanded. The bar only rotates very slightly when pulling too hard (rotates on its axis, but does not slide). Other than that, if well installed, this bar will work perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Pam

customer_reviews.title: Great Product at a Competitive Price
customer_reviews.text: Excellent price for this easy to install bar. Using it to hang a yoga trapeze in a doorway. Fast shipping. Delighted with this purchase
customer_reviews.author: AlienEyesArts

customer_reviews.title: the cheapest alternative for a sit up and a pull up bar.
customer_reviews.text: as advertised. the pins you screw on the door jams secure the bar and you don't have to really tighten it because the small anchors do a great job. it's an inexpensive way to do your pt before getting to boot camp. it was for my son.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Lauron

customer_reviews.title: My nephew loves it
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my nephew, who is a competitive swimmer, and takes his training seriously. He really likes it. Fits easily to the door frame and he says it is really sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Audrey

customer_reviews.title: GET IT
customer_reviews.text: want to quite the gym? want REAL core strength? invest in this bar easy to install, very sturdy great price
customer_reviews.author: Don C

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and Flimsy
customer_reviews.text: Flimsy and would nit hold my 170lb son when it states up to 250lb. Paid $37 for and only getting back $12 - DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Mommarden

customer_reviews.title: Basic but holds and works.
customer_reviews.text: Make sure you drill pilot holes before using the provided screws. The screws are not very good quality so they can become easily stripped after a few turns. Other than that, the bar is fair quality, easy to install, mount and dismount. So far it has worked great for basic moves. This is not meant for swinging, since the mount / dismount mechanism is by turning (screwing) both ends of the bar.
customer_reviews.author: Ivan Buchanan

customer_reviews.title: Good Bar
customer_reviews.text: I can not imagine what the bars costing 2 to 3 times as much could offer to justify the additional cost. This bar is solid and easy to install.
customer_reviews.author: GMS

customer_reviews.title: Great little chin up bar
customer_reviews.text: Overall this is a great little pullup bar. My girlfriend has one that she didn't even screw into the door frame and it holds us both just fine although she has to adjust it here and there. After using hers, I bought one and did screw it into my door frame and it hold me (165lbs) jumping and grabbing it and doing a variety of other movements. The only drawback is the hand pads. They seem to be perfect for chin ups but I need them to be wider for pullups. Not that big a deal though. I just grab the metal instead.
customer_reviews.author: Kris

customer_reviews.title: When you fix this on your door frame, it ...
customer_reviews.text: When you fix this on your door frame, it is possible the door frame will start splitting and will result in damage of the door frame. This type of pull up bar requires you to drill holes to keep the bar in place. If you hand tighten the ends, it is possible that the pull up bar may slip out, so be careful when children are trying to exercise using this. Even when adults are working out, you got to be careful that the bar wont come off the frame even if tightened at the ends without the end caps secured to the door frame with screws.
customer_reviews.author: sunshine

customer_reviews.title: It works great! The pull up bar is very easy to ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband and I to use in our apartment. It works great! The pull up bar is very easy to set up and take back down when you don't need it. It fits in our doorway and holds both of us well. We've used it without the cups and it has never slipped or left any marks on our doorframe. This product works great at a variety of heights to try different moves and is perfect for renters!
customer_reviews.author: Erin Stucker

customer_reviews.title: A+++
customer_reviews.text: Quick easy set up! Just what I needed overall very happy with purchase! With bar removed the brackets are barely noticeable! A++
customer_reviews.author: Jordan.F

customer_reviews.title: Uses screws and a drill for support
customer_reviews.text: Guess I missed the fact you need to drill holes in your wall before you can use this. I am sure it would be sturdy but not at the price of drilling holes to use it.
customer_reviews.author: MISHMANKA

customer_reviews.title: Works if you can't buy the hanging bars!
customer_reviews.text: When you can't use a chin-up bar that hangs on your door frame, opt for one of these guys. It WILL leave marks in the insides of your frame, however. But when my doorway was too small for the other models, this definitely came in handy. It can support my 150lbs easily, but I have 220lb+ friends who would put an uncomfortable bend in it. Depending on your doorway, it's wide enough to be able to extend for extended grip pull-ups/chin-ups.
customer_reviews.author: AverageJoe

customer_reviews.title: Pull ups feel great. Chin ups feel great especially with the cushion
customer_reviews.text: Solid construction. Pull ups feel great. Chin ups feel great especially with the cushion. Great value. It was easy for me to install, it does require a drill or strong patience arms. I did swap out the screws for my own wood screws.
customer_reviews.author: GenChau

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Simple installation and sturdy once installed. I like that it’s small so it doesn’t take up a lot of space or look bulky.
customer_reviews.author: Nikki Duran

customer_reviews.title: For Safety, please follow directions.
customer_reviews.text: Even though this has screw-to-tighten in door jamb feature, you MUST use the screws and cups otherwise you'll break your neck...do read and follow instructions for a really good chin up bar or to use with Inversion Boots. smile emoji.
customer_reviews.author: MG

customer_reviews.title: Can't install with low-end metal screws that stripped
customer_reviews.text: These screws strip even though holes are drilled; very poorly manufactured and this is the most important part for securing the bar in place. Round head screws should be replaced with flathead to leave more room for the bar to be securely locked in place. I'll have to get an expert to remove these. I can't get them out with pliers because the metal shavings are produced when using pliers to try to remove. POOR PRODUCT!!!
customer_reviews.author: Michele Berkey

customer_reviews.title: Cheap
customer_reviews.text: You do screw it into the wall, so there is no danger of it falling down...however, it doesn't tighten very well, and over time it gets to the point where the bar rotates while you're trying to do pull-ups. No good.
customer_reviews.author: the angels have the phone box

customer_reviews.title: Unhappy
customer_reviews.text: This thing is not what I expected and it appeared to have been returned previously more than once. Parts missing. I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Glynda Soetebier

customer_reviews.title: sturdy enough, cheap enough
customer_reviews.text: sturdy enough, cheap enough. only complaint is that you have to twist the bar to tighten it, and it put a crack in my door frame and it wasnt even that tight. be careful when mounting it and tightening it up in your doorframe. otherwise, the bar works fine, loosens up from normal use so it always needs tightened down, but it was cheap and it gets the job done for sure
customer_reviews.author: John Doe

product_meta.title: Sunny Health & Fitness Door Way Chin Up and Pull Up Bar
product_meta.description: Maximize your workout with the Sunny Health & Fitness Doorway Chin-Up Bar. Sturdy, chrome plated steel bar, with a max weight capacity of 220 lb. , and non-slip, soft padded hand grips ensure maximum stability and grip. The simplicity of the Sunny Health & Fitness Doorway Chin Up Bar is its strongest asset as it allows you to have full control of your workout. Adjustable length (24. 5 to 36 inches) provides a customizable workout area and fits into any standard door frame. It is the ultimate multi-tool workout bar as it is ideal for pull-ups, chin-ups, leg lifts, or you can use it as a foot anchor for sit-ups and crunches. Includes weight bearing brackets for maximum stability during your chin-ups and non-weight bearing brackets for sit-ups; the brackets ensure you are adequately supported during your exercise.
feature_bullets: STURDY CHROME PLATED STEEL BAR: Train like a pro with the tough and secure exercise trainer supporting tough workouts. When mounted properly, the fitness bar holds up to 220 pounds giving you full support for pull-up and chin ups.
ADJUSTABLE LENGTH: Easily adjust this exercise bar so you can take your fitness on the go! Adjustable length (24. 5 to 36 inches) provides a customizable workout.

COMFORT GRIPS: Minimize risks of calluses or hand cramping with padded handles. Non-slip extra-long foam grips for extra comfort to minimize hand fatigue. Put the door bar lower to the ground and use it to help you perform push-ups!
MAXIMUM STABILITY: Includes weight bearing brackets for maximum stability during your chin-ups and non-weight bearing brackets for sit-ups. Fits into any standard door frame
EASY STORAGE: Set up in seconds in almost any doorframe and easily store away in a closet. Adjustable length (24. 5 to 36 inches) provides a customizable workout for your home and body.
*TO ENSURE USER SAFETY, PLEASE READ INCLUDED INSTRUCTIONS. ALL NECESSARY SCREWS AND PARTS MUST BE PROPERLY INSTALLED BEFORE THE DEVICE SHOULD BE USED*

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
